title: IOC Officially Adds Esports to 2028 Los Angeles Olympics
introText: The International Olympic Committee has officially added esports to the 2028 Los Angeles Olympic Games. Competitive gaming will become a medal sport, marking historic recognition for the $200 billion industry.

content.content: The IOC approved esports as a medal sport after years of consideration. Events will include racing, sports simulations, and fighting games. Shooter games were excluded due to violence concerns.
Olympic inclusion validates esports as legitimate athletic competition. The industry generates $200 billion annually and reaches over 500 million fans worldwide.
National Olympic committees will now develop esports programs to identify and train athletes. Qualification events will begin in 2027.
